column2: Notlit, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had my first seizure after a car accident in 1975.  I was on anything and everything for seizures.  When we moved to Colorado in 1997 from Maryland and found a rural doctor who was quite knowledgeable of seizures he changed my meds to Tegretol and took me off of 4 other meds.  I have been seizure free for 12 years using Tegretol (brand only).  Currently using a maintenance level of 400 mg per day.  Tegretol has left me with no side effects.  Stress level is very low here in the mountains - which helped my blood pressure, anxiety, etc.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)

I would highly recomend it for the treatment of someone trying to cope with bipolar at the end of a short rope.  I have tried ALL the bipolar meds out there in every combo you can dream up except lithium and depakote...so I've circled the block a few times and this is deff worth a try.

column2: Gwen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on tegretol 200mg, once in the morning and later at suppertime with my other meds, since June 2007. Trigeminal Neuralgia attack last June 2007, holding onto the front and back of my head and being rushed to the hospital with 200 over 156 blood pressure when I got there. There is no way to describe the pain, except to say a gun would have been the only relief.  In olden days called the suicide syndrome, I personally know why having experienced trigeminal neuralgia first hand.  Since taking tegretol no more attacks, thank you Lord.  I was taking every night copaxone shot, for multiple sclerosis then found out its the weakest of meds!!!  Now, I am on Tysabri once a month infusion, and no relapses since I have been on it for multiple sclerosis.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have not felt myself since I was put on this a couple of months ago. I hate it. My EEG was abnormal so dr. put me on this drug. I cannot take it anymore. It makes me sick (vomiting) and really weird. I am done with it. lifeis2good, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was previously on Dilantin.  Because, I needed so much of that medicine to get my levels right, I was totally worthless.  Beyond tired - absolutely exhausted.  It was as if I were drugged.  A year ago, my Dr. switched me to this drug (700 mils a day, taken twice a day - morning and night).  At the beginning, the medicine altered my moods and I was extremly happy.  Also, no more exhaustion.  HOWEVER, the adverse affect I experienced was a sore throat.  I had an ultrasound of my throat and lymphnodes taken and all was normal.  I'm still on this med and the sore throat has calmed down to almost extinction.  I've researched other meds and find this one (w/the exception of the sore throat) to be fitting for me because it doesn't make me sleepy, confused, etc. - I do not experience any other adverse reactions as I've read in other reviews on this matter.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: Has helped to keep drug levels even.  Don't have the fluctuations that were seen with just the oral tablet

I started taking tegretol and the next day started to have double vision. I tried to wait it out, but it just got worse. I stopped and restarted the medicine to see if it would do better a second time around and it just put me to sleep. It ruined my birthday.
